document.heading: Natural Disaster Consumer Protection Temporary Act of 1989

history.narrative: Law 8-51, the “Natural Disaster Consumer Protection Temporary Act of 1989,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-330. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 27, 1989 and July 11, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 1, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-85 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 8-51 became effective on October 19, 1989.
